DataElement.preferredName: Prior Therapy Measurable Disease Evaluable Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding the presence of measurable and evaluable disease after administration of prior therapy that meets the criteria for a person to participate in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Therapy Measurable Disease Evaluable Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._A tumor that can be accurately measured in size. This information can be used to judge response to treatment._Disease that cannot be measured directly by the size of the tumor but can be evaluated by other methods specific to a particular clinical trial._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Measurable Disease Evaluable Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor that can be accurately measured in size. This information can be used to judge response to treatment.:Disease that cannot be measured directly by the size of the tumor but can be evaluated by other methods specific to a particular clinical trial.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that a subject has one or more measurable pathological lesions.
Disease that cannot be measured directly by the size of the tumor but can be evaluated by other methods specific to a particular clinical trial.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient greater than or eq
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient greater than or equal to 4 weeks from prior treatment and shows progressive measurable/evaluable disease in the liver after regional therapy OR has measurable disease outside the liver?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior radiation, are the measurable lesions outside the radiation field?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient had prior regional treatments for liver metastasis, is patient greater than or equal to 4 weeks from treatment and shows progressive measurable/evaluable disease in the liver after regional therapy OR has measurable disease outside the liver?
